title: Bucks Bounce Back, Blast Tigers
text:
MIKE CARROLL/HURON PLAINSMAN Sheldon Gant 
Yankton’s Sheldon Gant carries the ball during the opening half of a game Friday against Huron at Tiger Stadium. Posted: Friday, October 9, 2015 10:55 pm Bucks Bounce Back, Blast Tigers 0 comments 
HURON – The Yankton High School football team got back on track in a big way Friday night. 
Coming off consecutive shutouts, the Bucks exploded for 38 points in the first half and rolled to a 45-18 victory over Huron in Eastern South Dakota Conference football action in Huron. 
Not only were the 45 points the most for Yankton since the 2013 season, the Bucks extended their winning streak over Huron to 21 games. 
Tanner Frick scored Yankton’s first two touchdowns, runs of five and 32 yards. Sheldon Gant picked off a pass and returned it 20 yards for a score to give the Bucks a 22-0 lead after one quarter. 
Yankton continued its offensive outburst in the second quarter. Jared Rafferty hit a 26-yard field goal, Sheldon Gant scored on a 21-yard run and Nate Stephenson hit Brendan Caskey for a 38-yard score to give the Bucks a 38-0 lead at the half. 
Caskey then opened the third quarter with a 31-yard touchdown run to give the Bucks a 45-0 cushion. 
Huron (2-5) got its offense going after that, scoring on a Hyland Heinz 43-yard touchdown pass to Greg Conrad. Alex Hill later scored a pair of rushing touchdowns, to cut the final margin to 45-18. 
Caskey finished the game with 78 rushing yards on 15 carries. 
Yankton, now 4-3 on the season, returns home to face Douglas next Friday night.
